file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 56-20-01-07 - PASSENGER CABIN WINDOWS - CLEANING/PAINTING

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PASSENGER CABIN WINDOWS - CLEANING/PAINTING EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. The procedures given in this section are applicable to do the cleaning of the passenger cabin windows. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY PASSENGER CABIN WINDOWS - CLEAN- ALL 56-20-01-100-801-A ING EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 56-20-01 Page 1 of 3 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 56-20-01-100-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. PASSENGER CABIN WINDOWS - CLEANING A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to clean the passenger cabin windows. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To get access to the passenger cabin win- Workstand available dows from the outside Commercially Soft lint-free cloth To clean the passenger cabin windows available E. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Divoplus V3 Detergent (solution - 10% detergent + 90% warm water) AR Triton X-100 Non-ionic detergent or equivalent AR Isopropyl alcohol ( solution - 50% alcohol + 50% warm wa- FED SPEC TT-I-735 AR ter) TT-N-95 Type II Naphta, Aliphatic AR P-D-680 Type I Dry Solvent AR AMS 1526B Extreme Simple Green AR F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Outside and inside the passenger cabin H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Put the work stand in position and get access to the passenger cabin windows from the outside. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 56-20-01 Page 2 of 3 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Cleaning SUBTASK 110-003-A WARNING: CLEANING PRODUCTS ARE TOXIC AND FLAMMABLE. A GOOD FLOW OF AIR MUST BE AVAILABLE WHEN THE WORK IS DONE IN A CLOSED AREA. CAUTION: • DO NOT PERMIT THE CLEANING PRODUCTS (SOLVENTS) TO TOUCH PAINT-FINISH SURFACES, PLASTICS, OR SEALANT BEADS NOT TO CAUSE DAMAGE TO THEM. • DO NOT PUT REMAINING CLEANING MATERIAL BACK INTO ORIGINAL CONTAINERS TO PREVENT CONTAMINATION. • DO NOT POUR CLEANING PRODUCT DIRECTLY ON THE SURFACE TO BE CLEANED. • DO NOT PERMIT CLEANING PRODUCT TO EVAPORATE BEFORE IT IS DRIED WITH THE LINT-FREE CLOTH. • DO NOT WEAR CLOTHES WITH ZIP FASTENERS, OR USE METAL OBJECTS (SUCH AS WATCHES, BRACELETS, AND RINGS) OR METAL TOOLS WHEN YOU CLEAN THE WINDOWS, BECAUSE THEY MAY SCRATCH THE TRANSPARENCY, AND CAUSE OPTICAL DISTORTIONS. • WHEN YOU CLEAN THE WINDOWS, DO NOT USE ABRASIVE MATERIALS, BECAUSE THEY MAY SCRATCH THE TRANSPARENCY, AND CAUSE OPTICAL DISTORTIONS. (1) Clean the passenger cabin windows surface as follows: (a) Use a cloth dampened with the material specified in the Consumable Materials Table. Choose the material that you need from the Consumable Materials Table. NOTE: To better application using the Extreme Simple Green use the ratio of 8 ml of Extreme Simple Green to 1 liter of the water. (b) Wash the window with soft circular strokes until all dust is removed. (c) Remove all of the used solution with a cloth soaked in water. (d) Rub the window dry with a dry, clean cloth. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Remove the workstand from the work area. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 56-20-01 Page 3 of 3 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A.
